hasDitaContent.@value: Aceclofenac potentially increases the risk of seizures when given with moxifloxacin. Manufacturer advises caution.

hasDitaContent.@value: Moxifloxacin increases the anticoagulant effect of acenocoumarol. Manufacturer advises monitor INR.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Moxifloxacin   increases   the anticoagulant effect of   acenocoumarol .  Manufacturer advises monitor INR .

hasDitaContent.@value: Aluminium hydroxide decreases the absorption of moxifloxacin. Manufacturer advises moxifloxacin should be taken 2 hours before or 4 hours after aluminium hydroxide.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Aluminium hydroxide   decreases   the absorption of   moxifloxacin .  Manufacturer advises  moxifloxacin  should be taken 2 hours before or 4 hours after  aluminium hydroxide .

hasDitaContent.@value: Both moxifloxacin and amifampridine prolong the QT interval. Most manufacturers advise avoiding the use of two or more drugs that are associated with QT prolongation. Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Both  moxifloxacin  and  tolterodine  prolong the QT interval. Most manufacturers advise avoiding the use of two or more drugs that are associated with QT prolongation. Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.

hasDitaContent.@value: Torasemide is predicted to cause hypokalaemia (potentially increasing the risk of torsade de pointes) when given with moxifloxacin. Manufacturer makes no recommendation.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Torasemide   is predicted to   cause   hypokalaemia (potentially increasing the risk of torsade de pointes) when given with   moxifloxacin .  Manufacturer makes no recommendation .

hasDitaContent.@value: Moxifloxacin increases the anticoagulant effect of warfarin. Manufacturer advises monitor INR.
